@lolyu this is a good question. I will wait to merge for now, in case this fix ends up covering up a deeper issue.

The packet caused this issue is like:
```
###[ Ethernet ]###
  dst       = 6e:b8:57:72:99:af
  src       = 80:3f:5d:08:0d:8e
  type      = 0x800
###[ IP ]###
     version   = 4L
     ihl       = 5L
     tos       = 0x0
     len       = 52
     id        = 24932
     flags     = DF
     frag      = 0L
     ttl       = 63
     proto     = tcp
     chksum    = 0xd834
     src       = 10.64.247.30
     dst       = 10.64.246.140
     \options   \
###[ TCP ]###
        sport     = 39573
        dport     = 10900
        seq       = 3469577059
        ack       = 1487820594
        dataofs   = 8L
        reserved  = 0L
        flags     = A
        window    = 32406
        chksum    = 0xff4b
        urgptr    = 0
        options   = [('NOP', None), ('NOP', None), ('Timestamp', (3222068554, 500264011))]
```
Looks like a `ptf_nn_agent` packet, but still no idea why the filter not working as expected. Let's merge this PR to address this issue first.

Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).
I was wondering if this feature could be combined with icmp_responder into a service? I think these two features are dependent with each other.

> I was wondering if this feature could be combined with icmp_responder into a service? I think these two features are dependent with each other.

There is a future change pending for Linkmgrd which would cause this service to not be required to run constantly, only at the start of each test session. So I think it is better to keep it separate, since eventually this will become a oneshot service.
The script has been verified on dualtor-2, confirmed working functionality.

how about splitting each show command into its own test in the same test_sfp.py

> how about splitting each show command into its own test in the same test_sfp.py

I think it makes things cleaner to have one file dedicated to testing one utility.

The `show platform ...` subcommands will be tested in test_show_platform.py, `sfputil` subcommands will be tested in test_sfputil.py and sfpshow commands will be tested in test_sfpshow. It will help isolate the tests and also keep the file sizes down.
@jleveque Have refactored test_sfp into smaller tests under platform_tests/sfp. Please re-review.

comments.body: While this is a good idea to get test going. how can we warn and cleanup these garbage bridges?

> While this is a good idea to get test going. how can we warn and cleanup these garbage bridges?

It should not be the mux simulator's responsibility to cleanup garbage bridges. Probably we should record some key information of running test setup in a file on test server after add-topo. The key information should include the topology name. While running remove-topo, firstly check if the topology to be removed matches the recorded running topology. If no, fail early to avoid leaving garbage bridges.

Not merging this PR yet as the verification is blocked, due to some issues in simulating switchover scenario and the lack of ICMP responder in PTF to relay link manager packets.

This is ready for merge now. The code has been tested with the switchover scenario, finally. Upon simulating a switchover, the traffic was disrupted for 0.071s (<1s), and 19 packets were lost.
These numbers are within the present expected range for the ToR switchover.

```
09:53:48 INFO dual_tor_io.py:examine_each_packet:404: Total number of filtered incoming packets captured 35981

09:53:48 ERROR dual_tor_io.py:start_io_test:140: The longest disruption lasted 0.008 seconds. 2 packet(s) lost.
09:53:48 ERROR dual_tor_io.py:start_io_test:142: Total disruptions count is 16. All disruptions lasted 0.071 seconds. Total 19 packet(s) lost
FAILED             
```

Supported commands
  • help:
    • Get descriptions, examples and documentation about supported commands
    • Example: help "command_name"
  • list:
    • List all pipelines for this repository using a comment.
    • Example: "list"
  • run:
    • Run all pipelines or specific pipelines for this repository using a comment. Use this command by itself to trigger all related pipelines, or specify specific pipelines to run.

  • where:
    • Report back the Azure DevOps orgs that are related to this repository and org
    • Example: "where"

See additional documentation.

comments.body: @wangxin @yxieca could you please take a look? Thank you in advance!
@jleveque @theasianpianist , the change looks good to me. Can you guys also take a look?
Please use the testmg.sh script to verify your changes.

@dmytroxshevchuk I need to revert this PR. We found following issue with platform.json as grant truth:

For example, on a Mellanox 2700 device, if we want to deploy the 100G topology:

The platform.json's alias table:
"alias_at_lanes": "etp1a, etp1b, etp1c, etp1d",

ept1a would be used for Ethernet0's alias and that causes minigraph generation error.

With non-breakout topologies, the alias should be etp1.

@yxieca issue with platform.json was fixed in sonic-buildimage
issue for that: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/issues/6024
PR for that: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/6831
So I created another PR with the same changes considering on Mellanox platform.json issue.
Please take a look:
https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/pull/3469

This pull request **fixes 1 alert** when merging b5ae876114615ac92cb33be74adadad442c2510d into be84f77180d61c5e29bd93f53ed89102e4361f52 - [view on LGTM.com](https://lgtm.com/projects/g/Azure/sonic-mgmt/rev/pr-b2db123fbc5e813f5a9ca0bbb208a944af959446)

**fixed alerts:**

* 1 for Unused import

@Staphylo, @zzhiyuan: Can you please review this? Is there a reason Arista uses "orange" rather than "amber"? It would be preferred if all vendors followed the same naming convention,, so that we don't need platform-specific changes like this.

> @Staphylo, @zzhiyuan: Can you please review this? Is there a reason Arista uses "orange" rather than "amber"? It would be preferred if all vendors followed the same naming convention,, so that we don't need platform-specific changes like this.

I do believe it would be easier if Arista changes their implementation to use amber instead of orange. We can make this change in our drivers.

> > @Staphylo, @zzhiyuan: Can you please review this? Is there a reason Arista uses "orange" rather than "amber"? It would be preferred if all vendors followed the same naming convention,, so that we don't need platform-specific changes like this.
> 
> I do believe it would be easier if Arista changes their implementation to use amber instead of orange. We can make this change in our drivers.

Thanks, @zzhiyuan! Yes, it will help keep the common code clean.

@antoninamelnyk: Can you please remove the Arista LED-related changes from this PR and instead open an issue in this repo describing the issue so we can track it until @zzhiyuan makes the changes in the Arista platform API?
@jleveque I updated this PR with Carl's LED fix https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/6468
@jleveque done, I removed Arista LED-related changes
@vdahiya12 can we move forward on this PR?
@yxieca can this be merged? thanks in advance!
@jleveque could you please take a look? Thank you!
@Junchao-Mellanox I see you fixed the assert to python_assert as recommended on your recent changes but I would suggest to replace all the asserts in the code with this one.

> @Junchao-Mellanox I see you fixed the assert to python_assert as recommended on your recent changes but I would suggest to replace all the asserts in the code with this one.

I will change all assert to pytest_assert in test_platform.info.py.

Ying suggest that add stress test to this HLD.

There are few concerns:
1. We need double our DUT(for now, we need two [SONiC + Console] with different Console wiring)
1. Seems like we haven't added stress test for regular DUT before? If no, why we think the high traffic testing on regular DUT is unnecessary. If yes, do we have best practice on stress testing?

Actually, I've done some stress testing for Console switch hardware(https://github.com/Blueve/sonic-development-private), just want to figure out if put this kind of test to sonic-mgmt is properly.
@yxieca I've update the stress test part, could you please kindly review?

@wangxin @yxieca - can you please review

At the time of putting this PR, the configuration required for supervisor card was not finalized. For Nokia supervisor card, we have a bare minimal config. If we require a template, then we can remove the 'supervisor' related changes from this PR and a subsequent PR can handle the generation of minigraph for supervisor card.
